facts.fact: On July 5, 1921, Australia secured a 219-run victory over England in the third Ashes Test at Leeds, marking their eighth consecutive win in the Ashes series, a record for the longest winning streak by either team in the history of the Ashes.

Sri Lankan legend Sanath Jayasuriya reached a significant career milestone on July 5, 2005, becoming the fourth cricketer in history to cross the 10,000-run mark in One Day International (ODI) cricket during a match against Australia.
Former Indian all-rounder and later manager of the Indian cricket team, Chandu Borde, was born on July 5, 1934.
Chetan Chauhan, the former Indian opening batsman and later administrator, was born on July 5, 1947.

script:
Did you know some legendary cricket moments happened today?

On July 5, 1921, Australia absolutely dominated England in the third Ashes Test at Leeds, securing their *eighth consecutive* Ashes win! This record-breaking streak showcases their incredible dominance, truly stamping their authority on the game's oldest rivalry. Imagine the pressure on England!

Fast forward to July 5, 2005, and we celebrate the "Matara Mauler," Sri Lankan legend Sanath Jayasuriya! He smashed through the 10,000-run barrier in ODIs against Australia, becoming only the fourth player ever to reach this monumental milestone. Jayasuriya redefined opening batting with his fearless, attacking style, changing how the limited-overs game was played forever. His impact on Sri Lankan cricket and the global game is undeniable.

Which one of these iconic moments do you remember most?
